places_with_reviews.name: Bhavanarayana Swamy Temple.
places_with_reviews.address: WF49+939, 13th Ward, Satyannarayana Puram, Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh 522101, India

reviews.text: Baptala's ancient Hindu temple stands as a city jewel, beckoning visitors to immerse themselves in its rich history and spiritual allure. A must-visit, it seamlessly blends the sacred with the urban, creating a unique experience for those exploring the heart of the city.

Very ancient temple, dating back to 1000 years. Built by Kukothunga Chola.
Cholas Legacy continue till today.

Very good temple. This was  built in 11th century time. Very few temples have in this historic back ground. I visited this temple and the  very peaceful environment here. The clock tower is very near to this temple. Here we have a good identity for this clock tower center from previous Decades of time. Recently re-built this clock tower for the old one has gone in a road extension. This new tower images are attached here....
Sri Bhavanarayana Swamy Temple in Bapatla is very ancient temple with brilliant architecture. Some Sasanas are there in the temple. It is well maintained and worth visit.

places_with_reviews.address: WF4F+27H, Srungarapuram, Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh 522101, India

reviews.text:
Last time when I saw this church few years ago it wasn't this big. This church was pervious a very small one but it was rebuilt a few years ago.
And now it's Huge.
Very well built and very spacious.
Also it is situated beside the main road (GBC Road).
Very good devotional place.
Awesome...loved the appearance. One of the oldest church in India. For sure it's a tourist attraction and a must visit place.
This is the largest church in Bapatla. It is near to old busstand. And it is in the centre of Bapatla Town. It is also a tourist place.
Very nice chruch surrounding area is beautiful with plants,inside chruch is spacious and simple design.
Very Famous And Big Church in Bapatla District

places_with_reviews.name: Sivalayam Temple
places_with_reviews.address: WF49+985, 13th Ward, Satyannarayana Puram, Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh 522101, India

reviews.text: This is very ancient Shiva temple, dating back to the Chola period. The vast court yard also has the Ayyappa Bhajana Mandali,  which offers food for devotees during Ayyappa season. Good vibe.   Very near to the Railway station.

places_with_reviews.name: Poleramma Temple
places_with_reviews.address: WF38+GH9, Maddiboinavaripalem, Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh 522101, India

reviews.text:
Out of Millions of local deities, she is our ancestral diety.
The temple was planned to demolish for road extension. But concerned authorities backed out after the consequences. Dont ask if i have witnessed them. Proof for me is the temple still out there

Poleramma! Goddess Poleramma is a Pre Vedic deity goddess, who is predominantly worshipped in the state of Andhra Pradesh. Poleramma is a local form of Sakti in Andhra pradesh. She is worshipped as Grama devata, Goddess who protects the village. Very powerful as per the rural people of Andhra Pradesh. Mother Poleramma is worshipped as a village guardian goddess to protect the village. The shrine is usually kept outside the village
Very powerful and popular goddess of bapatla town and once upon a time it is the starting point for town
It's a temple for devoting Durgamma goddess. It's has been built a decades ago. It's is known to everyone in bapatla.
It does not have place to sit to worshipping the goddess as it settles beside the guntur-chirala highway

places_with_reviews.name: Sai baba temple
places_with_reviews.address: Near new, bus stand, GBC Rd, Satyannarayana Puram, Bapatla, Andhra Pradesh 522101, India

reviews.text: A Holy Temple. Situated near APSRTCBus stand Bapatla. Several devotees daily visit the temple and offer prayers. Good facilities arranged for bhaktaas. Prasad am of Swamy will be distributed to them. Every day food/meals will be given to poor people and beggars. Opened from 5am to9pm. Good place and located on the high way. Every Thursday special poojas will be performed.

Most famous temple
Very near to new bus stand bapatla
One of the most visiting place among all the temples located in town
Baba statue seems same as it is in shiridi

Not very pleasent because it is side by main road
But once you enter the temple you will forget all those .
From my home town and visiting this temple gives lot of comfort and peaceful mind. It's regular temple to offer prayers.
It is one of the famous temples in Bapatla and is one of the few Saibaba temples in Andhra pradesh...i feel happy to have my home near to this temple
Sai Baba Temple, beside Old Bus Stand, Near to Patel Nagar, Peaceful Place.
